div.p: Greetings. As I am sending a courier to my most esteemed parent, I could not refrain from addressing you, even though I have nothing that greatly deserves writing, at least with a few words. I also informed Count Wittgenstein, in case he wanted to send you any letters, who sent me these attached.

Now, most illustrious man, whom I know to be entirely concerned with my prosperous affairs, I wanted to inform you that on the 19th of July, I was admitted into the inner council by the most illustrious Prince Elector. In this way of life, if I can be of any benefit to you or yours, I would prefer to show in action rather than words how much I value you.
Farewell, most distinguished man. On the 17th of August, in Heidelberg, in the year 1575.
Many greetings to Mr. Gwalther and Simler. Yours sincerely, Johann Philipp Freiherr von Hohensax, etc.
To the Reverend Heinrich Bullinger, the most faithful minister of the Church of Zurich, his most esteemed friend.
